summary: "Saturday Night Fever" is a 1977 movie about Tony Manero, a young Italian-American who loves dancing at a Brooklyn disco. Based on a magazine article, the film made John Travolta famous and helped make disco music popular worldwide. It showed off disco's music, fashion, and dance. The Bee Gees' soundtrack is one of the best-selling ever. The movie was a big hit and is now considered an important part of American culture, preserved in the National Film Registry.
title: Saturday Night Fever
